lead_paragraph: As appliances, cars and factory machines are computerized and connected to networks, we may become more efficient but hackers will have more to hack.

headline.print_headline: Stepping Up Security for an Internet-of-Things World
headline.main: Stepping Up Security for an Internet-of-Things World

snippet: As appliances, cars and factory machines are computerized and connected to networks, we may become more efficient but hackers will have more to hack....
abstract: Pentagon's Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency completes three-year-long Cyber Grand Challenge in which contestants had to create anti-hacking systems that could find and fix software vulnerabilities on their own; names three winning teams, with first place going to group from ForAllSecure, spinoff from Carnegie Mellon University; officials say competition's goal is to jumpstart development of autonomous cyberdefense and protect growing number of physical devices being connected to web.
